notice.ch: 生物醫學組博士班一年級，與LS6005A合併上課

remark.ch: 生物醫學組博士班一年級，與LS6005A合併上課

goal.ch:
“此課程主旨在藉由近期科學期刊文章閱讀、口頭報告、主題式報告帶領學生進入生命科學領域之研究。
課程目標：培養學生有閱讀、報告生命科學領域專業科學期刊的能力, 藉由科學期刊閱讀, 進而發掘問題、建立獨立思考、自我學習、邏輯分析與統整能力, 且訓練學生口頭報告的能力。“
goal.en: “This course is to bring students into areas of life science research by scientific paper reading, oral presentation, and theme topic presentation. It is expected that students have abilities to read and present scientific papers. By reading scientific papers, they can learn to discover scientific questions, establish the ability of independent thinking, and self-learning, and to organize and analyze scientific results logically. It also trains students to professionally present scientific results.“

outline.ch: 內容包含動物學、生物化學、細胞學、遺傳學、醫學、微生物學、分子生物學、神經生物學、藥學、生理學、植物學等領域
outline.en: “Topics include: Animal sciences, Biochemistry, Cell biology, Genetics, Medicines, Microbiology, Molecular Biology, Neurosciences, Pharmacology, Physiology and Plant sciences.“

textbook.ch: References: The newest scientific papers related to graduate student’s work.
textbook.en: References: The newest scientific papers related to graduate student’s work.

gradMethod.ch:
“Students will give presentation twice in a semester. The first presentation for student will be focused on their current research work. Student will need to choose a high-impact scientific paper published within 5 years and to present it in the class as their second presentation. Students will be required to ask at least one question per class. At the end of semester, student will be asked to hand in a short report summarized what they have learned during the semester. The short report will be written in English, the maximum pages including references for short report is 4 pages. 
Presentation I 30％
Presentation II 30％
Discussion 15％
Participation 15％
Report 10％
Total 100％“
gradMethod.en:
“Students will give presentation twice in a semester. The first presentation for student will be focused on their current research work. Student will need to choose a high-impact scientific paper published within 5 years and to present it in the class as their second presentation. Students will be required to ask at least one question per class. At the end of semester, student will be asked to hand in a short report summarized what they have learned during the semester. The short report will be written in English, the maximum pages including references for short report is 4 pages. 
Presentation I 30％
Presentation II 30％
Discussion 15％
Participation 15％
Report 10％
Total 100％“
